p: The barriers women and young girls face regarding access to health facilities include stigma and discrimination from healthcare workers, denial of care, provision of substandard care, physical and verbal abuse, longer waiting periods, passing care off to junior colleagues and disclosure and confidentiality [ 39]. Current issues that exacerbate this problem include lack of training for healthcare workers on human rights and medical ethics, resource limitations, limited accountability mechanisms and personal moral judgement around culpability. Stigma undermines access to diagnosis, treatment and successful health outcomes.
